title: Back-to-back stemplot of bear ages by gender

content.description: In northwest Pennsylvania, a zoologist recorded the ages, in months, of 55 bears and whether each bear was male or female. The data are shown in the back-to-back stemplot below.
content.question: Based on the stemplot, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The median age and the range of ages are both greater for female bears than for male bears.
The median age and the range of ages are both less for female bears than for male bears.
The median age is the same for female bears and male bears, and the range of ages is the same for female bears and male bears.
The median age is less for female bears than for male bears, and the range of ages is greater for female bears than for male bears.
The median age is greater for female bears than for male bears, and the range of ages is less for female bears than for male bears.

content.answer: The median age and the range of ages are both greater for female bears than for male bears.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
